reviewText: My kids and I saw this at one of the Rifftrax Live at our local theater and thought it was great fun.  That is why we bought the movie.I have and watch many Rifftrax movies, and some are better than others.  I don't think for us, they will ever replace the MST3K days, but at least it something close.If you like Rifftrax with Mike, Bill and Kevin, you will probably like this movie.

Title: N/A

reviewText: A new live show dvd from the Rifftrax crew, this time its the early 60's cult classic "Jack The Giant Killer", where a young man named Jack (big shock to the viewer I'm sure) rescues a princess from the clutches of a giant by killing it (the giant not the princess), the king has Jack take guard of the princess and attempt to hide her away at a nearby island but the ship is attacked by weird spirit creatures summoned by the evil wizard Pendragon and the princess is taken. From there its all about Jack trying to make his way to the wizard's castle to rescue said princess and save the world from evil.There's also a short called "What is nothing?" where two young boys ponder the true meaning of nothing. Its quite odd but the guys do their usual great job with the bad material these shorts provide. Also they do a fantastic job with the main feature which isn't that bad of a movie but is quite cheesy and some of the references in the movie make for plenty of good riffing.As far as Rifftrax dvds this is one of their best, the guys do very well and seem to have a lot of fun with the material and even the audience's reactions to their jokes.
summary: Huge, giant claymation...... and killing... well sort of.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're on this page then you probably already know what you're in for with Rifftrax so I won't explain.  What you do need to know is that this is probably their funniest live performance.  The short, "What is Nothing?", isn't their best ever but it is above average, but the main feature is a scream.  Jack the Giant Killer reminds me of the Russo-Finnish episodes of MST3k like "Jack Frost" in that its actually pretty good for what it is, but "what it is" has aged pretty badly and now its a cheesy camp-fest that's prime for riffing.  Just loads of material here, all very well performed.So if you liked MST3k eps like "Jack Frost" or "The Magic Sword", you'll be pleased with what you get here.  Great entry to the Rifftrax catalogue!  Keep 'em coming, guys!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have seen every MST3K episode multiple times, and am a big Rifftrax fan as well: I love and cherish them all. I think the best Rifftrax episodes are live, as is "Jack the Giant Killer," performed in front of a very appreciative audience in Nashville. While I haven't seen a Rifftrax installment I haven't liked yet, this one is not one of my favorites: the whole stop-motion, giant-infested fantasy love story makes for just plain boring viewing in several large swathes of the movie. Don't get me wrong the riffs are spot on and well-delivered, but compared to some of the other Rifftrax episodes I did not find this to be as entertaining as the norm due entirely to the ponderous and derivative nature of the underlying material. Having said that, it's worth seeing for fans, but for me the highlight of the disc is beyond doubt the extremely confusing and conceptually maddening short "What is Nothing?" Is it something? Watch it carefully and see if you can figure it out. Good luck!
summary: What Is Nothing? Is It Something?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Rifftrax, 'Jack the Giant killer': I didn't notice the label on the cover of the case that says 'Live' (bummer). I love and have most of the MST3K, Cinematic Titanic & Rifftrax DVDs, this one just didn't grab me as much. I listened closely and there are a lot of Great riffs - maybe it was the movie itself? I really prefer the studio Rifftrax to the 'Live' ones - although my favorite (Cinematic Titanic) is 'War of the insects' which is also live. On this DVD they have a couple of cartoon shorts - made to be on this DVD - a cute girl's voice - but NOT compatible for Rifftax. (And by the way I just saw in the theater 'Rifftrax Plan 9' - I have the studio one on DVD - but for the theater they added all this crap - including some guy - like a Weird Al wanna be - and it did NOT fit the movie (or pre-movie) AT ALL!! ZZZzz) And in a new attempt at movie making/magic - they alternate splitting the movie screen with the movie and or riff-heros. Please guys - I'd love to see you in-person live - but to buy your DVDs - I strongly prefer the studio work you do. Please keep making Rifftrax - love so many of the 'shorts' (favorite is 'Drugs are like that').Sincerely, Scott M.
summary: Cauton - this is a 'LIVE' DVD - just didn't grab me as much as others they have done
